spec.name: Royal Palace
spec.description: The Royal Palace of Casablanca (Dar el Makhzen) is a formal residence and administrative palace for the King of Morocco, located in the Habous Quarter area. Characterized by magnificent Moroccan architecture and extensive grounds, it serves as a center for royal protocol and official functions when the King is in the city. As a high-security royal compound, it is strictly **forbidden to the public**, although its exterior and impressive walls are visible from surrounding public areas.

timeline.title: Construction Period
timeline.description: The current palace structure was built or significantly expanded as part of the Habous Quarter development (Approximate date).

access.comment: The Royal Palace is a secured government building and is strictly forbidden to the general public.
